description: From Middle English miscolouren, equivalent to mis- +‎ colour. Compare Saterland Frisian Misklöär (“mismatched colour”).

verbs.description: miscolour (third-person singular simple present miscolours, present participle miscolouring, simple past and past participle miscoloured)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give a wrong colour to.
(transitive, figuratively) To set forth erroneously or unfairly.
